name: Melia Cabo Real All-Inclusive Beach & Golf Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I spent 2 great weeks here.
reviews.title: Nice smaller property, good value

reviews.text: The hotel is lovely and the staff were awesome.
reviews.title: The Most Memorable Time of Our Lives

reviews.text: We had a nice room with a partial ocean view that also over looked the golf course. The food at the La Palapa was good I especially enjoyed the tempura prawns and awesome service from Marco. And always a friendly greeting from Geraldo and Librado.
reviews.title: Nice beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Kujira a la carte was very good and the Manager Victor was amazing and he has an awesome smile. We also enjoyed our meals at La Terraza restaurant.
reviews.title: Nice resort

reviews.text: A lot of research went into where we would take our family vacation which included my wife, my 5 year old son, my 60 year old parents, and my 34 year old brother and his wife, and of course, myself. After looking at a lot of different options, it seemed Melia Cabo offered the best "value" for price vs what you would receive. The key to choosing this hotel was the swim-able beach, family/kid friendly resort and the price.
reviews.title: Great Resort For The Price

reviews.text: I will break down the review into 4 parts, which i think everybody wants/thinks about when they book a hotel: Food & Drinks, Rooms, Resort Grounds & Amenities and Service.
reviews.title: We loved the Melia in Cabo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD & DRINK
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: This part of the trip was very good. First time being to an all inclusive and non of us had any stomach issues. They have 2 al a carte restaurants, 1 buffet restaurant and a pool side snack bar.
reviews.title: More for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The Buffet serves breakfast, lunch and dinner - It is high up and over looks the whole ocean area of the bay end to end. Whales jumping in the distance, amazing sunset/sunrises...this place was awesome. The variety was great. The thing I noticed about the buffet, is that the food was ALWAYS HOT, if it wasn't, you simply notified the staff, and they would bring fresh batches within seconds. Another key to a good buffet, is to have fresh stations....they had fresh omelet stations, tortilla stations, grilled meat stations, etc. If you cant find good food here you like, you have a problem. IT IS A MUST to order a cappuccino at every meal...they were fantastic..they also do to go at any time as well for drinks!
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, away from the big crowds

reviews.text: Just got back from a week at Melia Cabo Real... It was our first stay there, but won't be our last! It's distance from town mean it is probably not the best spot for those looking to party, but it is a gem if you want some quiet time or have young kids!
reviews.title: Fantastico, especially for kids!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were able to enjoy a little quiet time by the pool thanks to an OUTSTANDING Kids Club. Our 3 and 5 year old boys loved spending time there. The facility was clean and safe, and I can't say enough about how great Angelica, Marisol and Stephanie were to our boys! Raul and Adrian from the Activities Team always had fun games for the kids as well.
reviews.title: Great get away for the price

reviews.text: My only recommendation: It would be great if there were benches near the playground so we had somewhere to sit while we watched the kids.
reviews.title: Second time here, will I return? Absolutely!

reviews.text: I'm a little confused by some of the negative reviews... For the price my wife and I thought the stay was very good. The resort is older (plaque in lobby states it opened in 1990), but it is in good shape. One caveat: the facilities are spread out, and there are no accessible elevators and quite a few stairs. I think any significant mobility issue would make this a difficult place to stay.
reviews.title: What happened to this place?

reviews.text: We had a nice garden view room (3105), which I gather is one of the ones that was recently renovated. The beds were a little hard, but toppers were available if you asked. The rooms were quiet, and we weren't bothered even though the heating/AC system is quite loud. Housekeeping was very good, and we saw no bugs, lizards or other creepy-crawlies that frequent tropical climes.
reviews.title: Good place for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned yesterday from a week long visit to the Melia. Having stayed in many other all inclusive resorts, I would rate the Melia a 4. The staff is fantastic, grounds beautifully maintained, lovely "swimmable beach", great beach for walking, food excellent.
reviews.title: Mexican Hospitality at it's Best

reviews.text: Yes, the actual hotel is outdated. The beds are hard, they usually are in Mexico, but this is the first time that I've ever asked for a mattress topper and was provided with one. We requested a king bed, no smoking and that is exactly what we got, except we were getting a garden view and the garden view included a beautiful view of the Hilton Lagoon. We could have coffee on our balcony and watch the whales!
reviews.title: Great resort with good service & awesome pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the buffet was wonderful. Great cappucinos in the morning. We ate twice at la Terrazza, really enjoyed the cuisine and the entertainment. They had a pianist and a saxophone player and the music was relaxing and lovely. The desserts in La Terrazza were delightful, especially the creme brule (the best I've ever had). We didn't get around to Kujira but everyone we met seemed to like it.
reviews.title: Get What You Pay For...Think Twice..

reviews.text: The bus stops on the highway right in front of the resort. $2 will take you whichever direction you wish. We went into Cabo San Lucas twice, once to Chileno (excellent snorkeling) and into San Jose del Cabo.
reviews.title: Great Vacation, Wish We Were Still There!

reviews.text: There were always seats around the pool. Unfortunately there were always towels saving the best seats all day, but that happens everywhere. I think if you asked, the staff would have moved peoples things for you. The music around the pool was really good. Not grating and overly noisy. Lots of variety.
reviews.title: Beautiful spot, exceptional service

aka: Melia Cabo Real All-Inclusive Beach & Golf Hotel Cabo San Lucas
